parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: An interventions domain that contains the agents administered to the subject as part of a procedure or assessment, as opposed to drugs, medications and therapies administered with therapeutic intent. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C117755, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTM DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the procedure agent category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Agent
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category for the [procedure/assessment agent]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the procedure agent subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the AGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.
fields.label: Subcategory for Agent
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory for the [procedure/assessment agent]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject was administered any procedure agents. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether any procedure/assessment agent(s) were administered.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Procedure Agent Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: AGYN
fields.questionText: [Were/Was] there any [procedure/assessment agent(s)] taken/administered?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile procedure agent records with AEs and/or MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: AG Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: AGSPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record only 1 procedure agent per line. Provide the full trade or proprietary name of the procedure agent; otherwise the generic name may be recorded.
fields.definition: Verbatim name of procedure/assessment agent administered.
fields.implementationNotes: In most cases, the verbatim drug names or treatment will be coded to a standard dictionary (e.g., WHODrug) after the data have been collected on the CRF. For the collection of verbatim procedure agents, the recommendation is to ask sites to provide the full trade or proprietary name since it is more exact than the generic. The full trade name provides the base generic and the appropriate salt for that particular drug. In addition, for coding purposes it helps with Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) classification system code selection. For example, Tylenol with codeine #1 has a different ATC code than Tylenol with codeine #3.
fields.label: Reported Agent Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGTRT
fields.questionText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent] [name/term]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indication that a specific procedure/assessment agent or group of agents is pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text interventions, the value of AGPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.
fields.label: AG Pre-Specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the procedure agent was administered, by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether the given procedure/assessment agent or group of agents was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific procedure/assessment agent is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: AGOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified procedure agent. AGOCCUR is not used for spontaneously free-text reported procedure agent(s). The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: AG Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If the response was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTAT with "NOT DONE".
fields.name: AGOCCUR
fields.questionText: [Has/Was] the subject (been) administered the [procedure/assessment agent]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose of the [procedure agent] taken per administration (e.g., 200).
fields.definition: The dose of procedure/assessment agent (e.g., --TRT ) given at one time represented as a numeric value.
fields.implementationNotes: Used when the dose/amount administered has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field AGDSTXT.
fields.label: AG Dose per Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGDOSE
fields.questionText: What was the individual dose per administration of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose of [procedure agent] taken per administration (e.g., 200).
fields.definition: The dose of procedure/assessment agent administered per instance.
fields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG AGDOSE (if numeric) or AGDOSTXT (if text).
fields.label: Procedure Agents Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to AGDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to AGDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: AGDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the individual dose of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78417

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose unit of the [procedure agent] administered (e.g., mg).
fields.definition: The unit associated with the procedure/assessment agent.
fields.implementationNotes: When sponsors collect data for amount of dose administered (i.e., Dose, Total Daily Dose), the unit must be collected as well (if applicable).
fields.label: AG Dose Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGDOSU
fields.questionText: What is the unit (for the dose of the [procedure/assessment agent])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78418

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the pharmaceutical dosage form (e.g., TABLET CAPSULE SYRUP) for the [procedure agent] [administered].
fields.definition: The pharmaceutical dosage form in which the AGTRT is physically presented.
fields.implementationNotes: Some drugs have multiple forms and this field may be needed to code the drug to an ATC level. However, in general, this level of detail should not be necessary except for procedure agents of interest.
fields.label: AG Dose Form
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGDOSFRM
fields.questionText: What was the dose form of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78419

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record how often the [procedure agent] was administered (e.g., ONCE).
fields.definition: The number of doses administered during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: The frequency of the procedure agent. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., AGDOSE, AGDOSEU, AGDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: AG Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78420

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the route of administration for the [procedure agent].
fields.definition: The route of administration of the procedure/assessment agent.
fields.implementationNotes: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture a procedure agent's route of administration, for purposes such as coding, and the procedure agent may have more than 1 route. Some companies may use route in coding procedure agents to be able to choose a precise preferred name and ATC code.
fields.label: AG Route of Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGROUTE
fields.questionText: What was the route of administration of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the procedure agent was first administered using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). Procedure agent(s) administered during the study are expected to have a complete start date.
fields.definition: The start date when the procedure/assessment agent was first administered, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have a start date or will indicate that the procedure agent was started before, during or after the study period. The preferred method is to collect a complete start date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for procedure agent started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.
fields.label: Procedure Agent Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: AGSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the procedure/assessment agent] start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [procedure agent] was started.
fields.definition: The time the procedure/assessment agent was started, represented in an ambiguous time format (e.g., h:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a procedure agent was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios supports it. Typically, a start time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a procedure agent administered or the subject records the start time in a diary. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and the SDTMIG for more information.
fields.label: Procedure Agent Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: AGSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent] start time?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check if the [procedure agent] was started before the study.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure/assessment agent was administered prior to [AGSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and the SDTMIG for more information.
fields.label: Prior Procedure Agents
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AGSTRF or AGSTRTPT. When populating AGSTRF or AGSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field AGPRIOR is "Y", a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When AGPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable AGSTRF should be populated. When AGPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables AGSTRTPT and AGSTTPT should be used. Note: AGSTRTPT must be in reference to the time-point anchor described in AGSTTPT.
fields.name: AGPRIOR
fields.questionText: Was the [procedure/assessment agent] administered prior to AGSTTPT? Was the procedure/assessment agent given prior to study start?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [procedure agent] as ongoing if the subject has not stopped taking the procedure agent at [the time point defined by the study]. If the procedure agent is ongoing, the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure/assessment agent is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: This box should be checked to indicate that theprocedure agent has not stopped at the time of data collection. It is expected that every recorded procedure agent should have either an end date or be checked as ongoing, but not both. However, in cases where ongoing procedure agents are not permitted, it may not be necessary to include an Ongoing field in the CRF. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submission, for more information about collecting relative date/time; see the SDTMIG for information about mapping relative times.
fields.label: Ongoing Procedure Agents
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AGENRF or AGENRTPT. When populating AGENRF, if the value of AGONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating AGENRTPT, if the value of AGONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When AGONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable AGENRF should be populated. When AGONGO is used in conjunction with another time point, the SDTMIG variables AGENRTPT and AGENTPT should be used. Note: AGENRTPT must be in reference to the time-point anchor described in AGENTPT.
fields.name: AGONGO
fields.prompt: Ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])
fields.questionText: Was the [procedure/assessment agent] ongoing (as of the [study-specific time point or period])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the procedure agent was topped using this format (DD-MM-YYYY). If the subject has not stopped [administering/being administered] the procedure agent leave this field blank.
fields.definition: The date the procedure/assessment agent was stopped/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g. DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an end date or will indicate that the procedure agent was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the end date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an end date in the CRF. For example, if all procedure agents are administered only once during a trial, the end date will be the same as the start date.
fields.label: Procedure Agents End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: AGENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent's] end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the procedure agent was stopped.
fields.definition: The time the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was started, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a procedure agent was ended only when a protocol or data collection scenarios require it or the subject records the end time in a diary. Typically, an end time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a procedure agent is stopped.
fields.label: Procedure Agents End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: AGENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent's] end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable (AGTRT) or the modified topic variable (AGMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. If PRPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized procedure name is being solicited, the data from AGTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG AGDECOD variable.
fields.label: Standardized Agent Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The class for the agent, often obtained from a coding dictionary.
fields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class used for analysis.
fields.label: AG Agent Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGCLAS

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The assigned dictionary code for the class of agent.
fields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class code used for analysis.
fields.label: AG Agent Class Code
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: AGCLASCD

label: Procedure Agents
name: AG
